project.name: Canteen Profiler
project.description: Profiler for PHP to measure memory usage and performance.

Profiler.name: Profiler
Profiler.description:
The Profiler is used to analyze your application in order to determine where you could use
the most optimization. The profiler class is where all interaction with the Profiler takes 
place. You use it to create step nodes and render the output.

params.name: parser
params.description: Optional to pass in existing Parser

ProfilerGhostNode.name: ProfilerGhostNode
ProfilerGhostNode.description: Ghost node used as a faux ProfilerNode and ProfilerSQLNode when the Profiler is disabled.

ProfilerNode.name: ProfilerNode
ProfilerNode.description: Class which represents the profiler steps

params.name: profiler
params.description: Reference to the profiler object

params.name: name
params.description: Name of this step

params.name: depth
params.description: Tree depth of this step

params.name: parentNode
params.description: Reference to this step's parent. null if top-level.

params.name: profilerKey
params.description: API key to identify an internal API call from an external one.

ProfilerRenderer.name: ProfilerRenderer
ProfilerRenderer.description: Rendering class used to render special step nodes.

params.name: topNodes
params.description: The collection of ProfilerNodes to render

params.name: showDepth
params.description: The depth amount to show

ProfilerSQLNode.name: ProfilerSQLNode
ProfilerSQLNode.description: Class representing each SQL query run

params.name: profiler
params.description: Reference to the profiler object

params.name: query
params.description: the sql query for this node

params.name: profileNode
params.description:
reference to the step 
that this query is running within

classitems.description: Original library from:
classitems.author: Jim Rubenstein <jrubenstein@gmail.com>

classitems.description: Used to insure that the {@link init} method is only called once.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Used to identify when the profiler has been enabled. If false no profiling data is stored, in order to reduce the overhead of running the profiler
classitems.name: enabled

classitems.description: Tracks the current step node.
classitems.name: currentNode

classitems.description: Tracks the current SQL note
classitems.name: sqlProfile

classitems.description: Tracks the current tree depth
classitems.name: depthCount

classitems.description: List of all top-level step nodes
classitems.name: topNodes

classitems.description:
Time the profiler was included. This is used to calculate 
time-from-start values for all methods as well as total running time.
classitems.name: globalStart

classitems.description:
Time the profiler 'ends'. This is populated just before rendering 
output (see {@link Profiler::render()})
classitems.name: globalEnd

classitems.description: Total time script took to run
classitems.name: globalDuration

classitems.description:
Global tracker for step times. Keeps track of how long each node 
took to execute.  This is used to determine
what is a "trivial" node, and what is not.
classitems.name: childDurations

classitems.description: Percentile boundary for trivial execution times
classitems.name: trivialThreshold

classitems.description: Execution time cut off value for trivial/non-trivial nodes
classitems.name: trivialThresholdMS

classitems.description: Total amount of time used in SQL queries
classitems.name: totalQueryTime

classitems.description:
Used to identify when some methods are accessed internally
versus when they're used externally (as an api or so)
classitems.name: profilerKey

classitems.description: A lightweight shell node used to return when the profiler is disabled.
classitems.name: ghostNode

classitems.description: The parser instance
classitems.name: parser

classitems.description: Create a constructor that basically says "don't construct me!"
Getter for the readOnly properties
Check to see if the profiler is enabled
classitems.name: isEnabled

return.description: True if profiler is enabled, false if disabled

classitems.description: Enable the profiler
classitems.name: enable

classitems.description: Disable the profiler
classitems.name: disable

classitems.description:
Start a new step. This is the most-called method of the profiler.  
It initializes and returns a new step node.
classitems.name: start

params.name: nodeName
params.description:
name/identifier for your step. is 
 used later in the output to identify this step

return.description:
returns an instance of 
	a {@link ProfilerNode} if the profiler is enabled, or 
 a {@link ProfilerGhostNode} if it's disabled

classitems.description: End a step by name, or end all steps in the current tree.
classitems.name: end

params.name: nodeName
params.description: ends the first-found step with this name. (Note: a warning is generated if it's not the current step, because this is probably unintentional!)

params.name: nuke
params.description: denotes whether you are intentionally attempting to terminate the entire step-stack.  If true, the warning mentioned is not generated.

return.description: |ProfilerNode|ProfilerGhostNode returns null if you ended the top-level step node, or the parent to the ended node, or a ghost node if the profiler is disabled.

classitems.description:
Start a new sql query

This method is used to tell the profiler to track an sql query.  These are treated differently than step nodes
classitems.name: sqlStart

params.name: query
params.description: the query that you are running (used in the output of the profiler so you can view the query run)

return.description: returns an instance of the {@link ProfilerGhostNode} if profiler is enabled, or {@link ProfilerGhostNode} if disabled

classitems.description: Stop profiling the current SQL call
classitems.name: sqlEnd

classitems.description: Increment the total query time This method is used by the {@link ProfilerGhostNode} to increment the total query time for the page execution. This method should never be called in userland. There is zero need to.
classitems.name: addQueryDuration

params.name: time
params.description: amount of time the query took to execute in microseconds.

return.description: Current amount of time (in microseconds) used to execute sql queries.

classitems.description: Get the total amount of query time
classitems.name: getTotalQueryTime

return.description: Total time used to execute sql queries (milliseconds, 1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the global start time
classitems.name: getGlobalStart

return.description: Start time of the script from unix epoch (milliseconds, 1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the global script duration
classitems.name: getGlobalDuration

return.description: Duration of the script (in milliseconds, 1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the global memory usage in KB
classitems.name: getMemUsage

params.name: unit
params.description: a metric prefix to force the unit of bytes used (B, K, M, G)

classitems.description: Render the profiler output
classitems.name: render

params.name: showDepth
params.description: the depth of the step tree to traverse when rendering the profiler output. -1 to render the entire tree

return.description: The render of the profiler to include on your page

classitems.description: Add node duration to the {@link Profiler::$childDurations} variable
classitems.name: addDuration

params.name: time
params.description: duration of the child node in microseconds

classitems.description:
Set the Percentile Boundary Threshold. 
This is used to set the percentile boundary for when a node is considered trivial or not.
By default, .75 is used.  This translates to the fastest 25% of nodes being regarded "trivial".
This is a sliding scale, so you will always see some output, regardless of how fast your application runs.
classitems.name: setTrivialThreshold

params.name: threshold
params.description: the threshold to use as the percentile boundary

classitems.description:
Calculate the time cut-off for a trivial step. 
Utilizes the {@link Profiler::$trivialThreshold} value to determine how fast a step must be to be regarded "trivial"
classitems.name: calculateThreshold

classitems.description: Determines if a node is trivial
classitems.name: isTrivial

params.name: node
params.description: The node to investigate

return.description: True if a node is trivial, false if not

classitems.description: Name of the step
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Tree depth of this step
classitems.name: depth

classitems.description: Time the step started. Stored as microseconds from the unix epoc.
classitems.name: started

classitems.description: Time the step ended. Stored as microseconds from the unix epoc.
classitems.name: ended

classitems.description: Total time the step ran INCLUDING it's children
classitems.name: totalDuration

classitems.description: Total time the step ran WITHOUT it's children
classitems.name: selfDuration

classitems.description: Total time children steps spent running
classitems.name: childDuration

classitems.description: The parent step to this node
classitems.name: parentNode

classitems.description: List of this step's direct children
classitems.name: childNodes

classitems.description: Number of queries run at this step
classitems.name: sqlQueryCount

classitems.description: List of this step's SQL queries
classitems.name: sqlQueries

classitems.description: Total time spent performing SQL queries. Stored in microseconds
classitems.name: totalSQLQueryDuration

classitems.description: Local reference to profiler key generated at initialization
classitems.name: profilerKey

classitems.description: Reference to the main profiler
classitems.name: _profiler

classitems.description:
End the timer for this step. Call this after the code that is being 
profiled by this step has completed executing
classitems.name: end

params.name: profilerKey
params.description: This is for internal use only! don't ever pass anything!

return.description: returns parent node, or null if there is no parent

classitems.description: This method is called by the Profiler::sqlStart method
classitems.name: sqlStart

params.name: sqlProfile
params.description: An instance of the {@link ProfilerSQLNode} to add to this step

return.description: reference to the {@link ProfilerSQLNode} object for the query initiated

classitems.description: Return the name of this step
classitems.name: getName

return.description: Name of this step

classitems.description: Return tree depth of this step
classitems.name: getDepth

return.description: Tree depth of this step

classitems.description: Return this step's parent node
classitems.name: getParent

return.description: Returns {@link ProfilerNode} object for the parent node to this step, or null if there is no parent

classitems.description: Increase the total time child steps have taken. Stored in microseconds
classitems.name: increaseChildDuration

params.name: time
params.description: Amount of time to add to the total child duration, in microseconds

return.description: Return number total time child steps have taken, in microseconds

classitems.description: Add child {@link ProfilerNode} to this node
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: childNode
params.description: the profiler node to add

return.description: Return a reference to this profiler node (for chaining)

classitems.description: Determine if this node has child steps or not
classitems.name: hasChildren

return.description: True if this node has child steps, false otherwise

classitems.description: Get the children steps for this step
classitems.name: getChildren

return.description: List of {@link ProfilerNodes} that are the child of this node

classitems.description:
Determine if this node has trivial children. Traverse the tree of child 
steps until a non-trivial node is found.  This is used at render time.
classitems.name: hasNonTrivialChildren

return.description: False if all children are trivial, true if there's at least one non-trivial

classitems.description: Determine if SQL queries were executed at this step
classitems.name: hasSQLQueries

return.description: True if there are queries, false if not

classitems.description: Get all the SQL queries executed at this step
classitems.name: getSQLQueries

return.description: list of {@link ProfilerSQLNode}s

classitems.description: Return number of queries run at this step
classitems.name: getSQLQueryCount

return.description: number of queries run at this step

classitems.description: Increment the total sql duration at this step
classitems.name: addQueryDuration

params.name: time
params.description: amount of time to increment the SQL duration by, in microseconds

return.description: Return instance of this step, for chaining

classitems.description: Get the total duration for SQL queries executed at this step in milliseconds
classitems.name: getTotalSQLQueryDuration

return.description: Duration of query time at this step, in milliseconds, 1 significant digit

classitems.description: Get the start time of this step in milliseconds
classitems.name: getStart

return.description: Start time of this step, in milliseconds, from unix epoch. (1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the end time of this step in milliseconds
classitems.name: getEnd

return.description: End time of this step, in milliseconds, from unix epoch. (1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the total time spent executing this node, including children
classitems.name: getTotalDuration

return.description: Duration of this step, in milliseconds. (1 significant digit)

classitems.description: Get the duration of execution for this step, excluding child nodes.
classitems.name: getSelfDuration

return.description: Duration of this step, excluding child nodes. (1 significant digit)

classitems.description: The rendered normal nodes
classitems.name: nodes

classitems.description: The rendered query nodes
classitems.name: queryNodes

classitems.description: Instance of the Profiler
classitems.name: _profiler

classitems.description: Destroy
Render a {@link ProfilerNode} step node and it's children recursively
classitems.name: renderNode

params.name: node
params.description: The node to render

params.name: maxDepth
params.description: the maximum depth of the tree to traverse and render.  -1 to traverse entire tree

return.description: The HTML markup rendering of the profiler node

classitems.description:
Render all {@link ProfilerSQLNode} queries for the given node, and traverse it's child nodes
to render their queries also.
classitems.name: renderNodeSQL

params.name: node
params.description: The node to begin rendering

return.description: The HTML markup rendering of the SQL node

classitems.description: The query that this object tracks
classitems.name: query

classitems.description: Reference to the step this SQL query runs in
classitems.name: profileNode

classitems.description: Start time of this query (in microseconds)
classitems.name: started

classitems.description: End time of this query (in microseconds)
classitems.name: ended

classitems.description: Duration for this query (in microseconds)
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description: Call stack backtrace of all methods/functions executed up until this SQL query is run
classitems.name: callstack

classitems.description: Reference to the main profiler
classitems.name: _profiler

classitems.description:
End the timers for this sql node. Call this method when 
the sql query has finished running.
classitems.name: end

return.description: return a reference to this query, for chaining.

classitems.description:
Get the query for this SQLNode. Query is parsed so extraneous 
spaces are removed where required.
classitems.name: getQuery

return.description: Query for this node

classitems.description:
Get the type of query this is. Parse the query and try to figure out 
what kind of query it is.
classitems.name: getQueryType

return.description: 'reader' if this is a select query, 'writer' if this is a typical writer query, or 'special' if it's another kind

classitems.description: Get the total execution duration for this query
classitems.name: getDuration

return.description: Execution duration for this query in milliseconds, rounded to 1 significant digit.

classitems.description: Get the start time of this query, from the unix epoch.
classitems.name: getStart

return.description: milliseconds from the unix epoch when this query started, rounded to 1 significant digit

classitems.description:
Return the call stack for this query. Reference the php documentation 
for {@link http://php.net/debug_backtrace debug_backtrace} for the 
structure of the return array.
classitems.name: getCallstack

return.description: call stack for this query
